required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate the Effects of BMS-813160 on Protein Loss in the Urine of Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes and Diabetic Kidney Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Randomized, Two-stage, Parallel-Group, Adaptive Design Phase 2a Study to Evaluate the Effects of BMS-813160 in Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus and Diabetic Kidney Disease (DKD) Who Have Residual Macroalbuminuria Despite Treatment With an Inhibitor of the Renin-Angiotensin System

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether BMS-813160 will reduce the amount of protein loss in the urine of subjects with type 2 diabetes and diabetic kidney disease

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Urinary Albumin-to-Creatinine Ratio (UACR) Across 12 Weeks of Treatment With BMS-813160
primary_outcome.description: The presence of albumin in the urine (macroalbuminuria) is a marker of kidney disease. Albumin and creatinine concentrations were obtained from spot urine samples. UACR was calculated as the geometric mean of two first-morning void urine UACR measurements with samples collected on two separate occasions within a 4-day period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Who Died and With Other (Not Including Serious) Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of subject's written consent until 30 days post discontinuation of dosing, assessed up to 26 months
secondary_outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. An AE can therefore be any unfavorable and unintended sign (example, a clinically significant abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of a drug, whether or not it is considered related to the drug. An SAE is an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death, initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization, life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying), persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or a congenital anomaly, or a medically important event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Out-of-Range Electrocardiogram (ECG) Interval
secondary_outcome.description: 12-lead ECGs were performed before and 1 hour after dosing at Weeks 0, 2 and 4. ECGs were recorded after the participant has been supine for at least 5 minutes. The PR interval was defined as the beginning of the P wave to the beginning of the QRS complex, and represents the time taken by electrical impulse to travel from the sinus node through the atrioventricular (AV) node. The QRS complex represented the rapid depolarization of the right and left ventricles. The QT interval was defined as the time from the start of the Q wave to the end of the T wave, and represents the time taken for ventricular depolarization and repolarization. Participants were evaluated for abnormal ECG intervals. Criteria's for abnormality were PR >200, QRS >120, QT >500, QTcF >450, Change From Baseline >30 milliseconds (msec).

secondary_outcome.measure: Trough Observed Plasma Concentration (Ctrough) of BMS-813160
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose at Week 2, 4, 8, 12 and 0.5, 1, 2, 4, and 6 hours post-dose at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Ctrough is the minimum estimated plasma concentration at steady state.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under The Plasma Concentration-Time Curve From Time Zero to 6 Hours Post-Dose [AUC(0-6 h)]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, 0.5, 1, 2, 4, and 6 hours post-dose at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: AUC(0-6 h) is the area under the plasma concentration-time curve from pre-dose (0 h) to 6 h post-dose.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, 0.5, 1, 2, 4, and 6 hours post-dose at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: CLr was calculated by dividing the total amount excreted in the urine from 0 to 6 hours by the area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero extrapolated to infinite time. The renal function was classified based on estimated glomerular filtration rate as normal (>=90 mL/min/1.73 m^2), mildly impaired (60-89 mL/min/1.73 m^2), moderately impaired stage 3A (45-59 mL/min/1.73 m^2), and moderately impaired stage 3B (30-44 L/min/1.73 m^2).

secondary_outcome.measure: Dose-Response Relationship Using Change in Baseline Urinary Albumin-to-Creatinine Ratio (UACR) Across 12 Weeks of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The presence of albumin in the urine (macroalbuminuria) is a marker of kidney disease. Albumin and creatinine concentrations were obtained from spot urine samples. UACR was calculated as the geometric mean of two first-morning void urine UACR measurements with samples collected on two separate occasions within a 4-day period. The effect of BMS-813160 on urinary albumin excretion as measured by UACR values in participants with diabetic kidney disease after 12 weeks of treatment was assessed. The model included treatment group as a main effect, and the log of baseline UACR values, as well as baseline values of eGFR, blood pressure, blood glucose and lipid levels, as covariates.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Arm A: BMS-813160 150 mg & Placebo matching with BMS-813160
arm_group.description: BMS-813160 150 mg capsules by mouth in AM and Placebo matching with BMS-813160 in PM for 12 weeks
BMS-813160 300 mg capsules by mouth twice daily for 12 weeks

arm_group.arm_group_label: Arm C: Placebo matching with BMS-813160
arm_group.description: Placebo matching with BMS-813160 0 mg capsules by mouth twice daily for 12 weeks

intervention.arm_group_label: Arm A: BMS-813160 150 mg & Placebo matching with BMS-813160
Arm A: BMS-813160 150 mg & Placebo matching with BMS-813160
Arm C: Placebo matching with BMS-813160

criteria.textblock:
For more information regarding BMS clinical trial participation, please visit www.BMSStudyConnect.com
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of type 2 diabetes mellitus with macroalbuminuria (UACR between 200 and 3500 mg/g)
- Background angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor (ACEI) or angiotensin-receptor blocker (ARB) therapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of type 1 diabetes
- Unstable cardiovascular, metabolic, or other chronic disease status
- Estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) <30 mL/min/1.73 m2
- High risk of infection or immune compromise
- Clinically significant ECG conduction abnormalities
- Drugs with significant potential to affect BMS-813160 exposure

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 319 were enrolled, 110 completed screening, rest 209 discontinued: (Main reason:did not meet study criteria). Of 110 screened, 98 entered Placebo Lead-in period of which 89 completed period, rest 9 discontinued (2 due to Admin. reason, 3 no longer met study criteria, 2 AEs and 2 were lost to follow-up.)1 was randomized but declined treatment

group.title: BMS-813160 150 mg QD
group.description: Participants received BMS-813160 150 mg, capsule, orally along with matching placebo in Ante Meridiem (AM) and 2 Placebo matching with BMS-813160, capsules, orally in Post Meridiem (PM) for 12 weeks. Participants were followed up for 4 weeks post treatment.

group.title: BMS-813160 300 mg BID
group.description: Participants received 2 BMS-813160 150 mg capsules, orally, twice daily (2*150 in AM and 2*150 in PM) for 12 weeks. Participants were followed up for 4 weeks post treatment.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants received BMS-813160 matching placebo capsules, orally, twice daily in AM and PM for 12 weeks and were followed up for 4 weeks post treatment.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Subject no longer meets study criteria

participants_list.participants: Includes 25 participants in this period and 3 participants re-joined for follow-up
Includes 24 participants in this period and 2 participants re-joined for follow-up

class.title: Change from baseline in QT >30 msec
Change from baseline in QTcF >30 msec

outcome.title: Trough Observed Plasma Concentration (Ctrough) of BMS-813160
outcome.description: Ctrough is the minimum estimated plasma concentration at steady state.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose at Week 2, 4, 8, 12 and 0.5, 1, 2, 4, and 6 hours post-dose at Week 12
outcome.population: The analysis was planned to be performed in the Pharmacokinetic (PK) analysis set which included all participants who receive a dose of study drug and have adequate PK concentration-time data. Data was not collected for any participants due to termination of the study

outcome.description: AUC(0-6 h) is the area under the plasma concentration-time curve from pre-dose (0 h) to 6 h post-dose.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, 0.5, 1, 2, 4, and 6 hours post-dose at Week 12
outcome.population: The analysis was planned to be performed in the Pharmacokinetic (PK) analysis set which included all participants who receive a dose of study drug and have adequate PK concentration-time data. Data was not collected for any participants due to termination of the study

group.title: BMS-813160 150 mg QD
group.description: Participants received BMS-813160 150 mg, capsule, orally along with matching placebo in Ante Meridiem (AM) and 2 Placebo matching with BMS-813160, capsules, orally in Post Meridiem (PM) for 12 weeks. Participants were followed up for 4 weeks post treatment.

measure.title: Area Under The Plasma Concentration-Time Curve From Time Zero to 6 Hours Post-Dose [AUC(0-6 h)]
measure.description: AUC(0-6 h) is the area under the plasma concentration-time curve from pre-dose (0 h) to 6 h post-dose.
measure.population: The analysis was planned to be performed in the Pharmacokinetic (PK) analysis set which included all participants who receive a dose of study drug and have adequate PK concentration-time data. Data was not collected for any participants due to termination of the study

outcome.title: Renal Clearance (CLr) of BMS-813160
outcome.description: CLr was calculated by dividing the total amount excreted in the urine from 0 to 6 hours by the area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero extrapolated to infinite time. The renal function was classified based on estimated glomerular filtration rate as normal (>=90 mL/min/1.73 m^2), mildly impaired (60-89 mL/min/1.73 m^2), moderately impaired stage 3A (45-59 mL/min/1.73 m^2), and moderately impaired stage 3B (30-44 L/min/1.73 m^2).
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, 0.5, 1, 2, 4, and 6 hours post-dose at Week 12
outcome.population: The analysis was planned to be performed in the Pharmacokinetic (PK) analysis set which included all participants who receive a dose of study drug and have adequate PK concentration-time data.Data was not collected for any participants due to termination of the study

measure.description: CLr was calculated by dividing the total amount excreted in the urine from 0 to 6 hours by the area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero extrapolated to infinite time. The renal function was classified based on estimated glomerular filtration rate as normal (>=90 mL/min/1.73 m^2), mildly impaired (60-89 mL/min/1.73 m^2), moderately impaired stage 3A (45-59 mL/min/1.73 m^2), and moderately impaired stage 3B (30-44 L/min/1.73 m^2).
measure.population: The analysis was planned to be performed in the Pharmacokinetic (PK) analysis set which included all participants who receive a dose of study drug and have adequate PK concentration-time data.Data was not collected for any participants due to termination of the study

outcome.title: Dose-Response Relationship Using Change in Baseline Urinary Albumin-to-Creatinine Ratio (UACR) Across 12 Weeks of Treatment
outcome.description: The presence of albumin in the urine (macroalbuminuria) is a marker of kidney disease. Albumin and creatinine concentrations were obtained from spot urine samples. UACR was calculated as the geometric mean of two first-morning void urine UACR measurements with samples collected on two separate occasions within a 4-day period. The effect of BMS-813160 on urinary albumin excretion as measured by UACR values in participants with diabetic kidney disease after 12 weeks of treatment was assessed. The model included treatment group as a main effect, and the log of baseline UACR values, as well as baseline values of eGFR, blood pressure, blood glucose and lipid levels, as covariates.
outcome.population: Data was not collected for any participants due to termination of the study

UACR was calculated as the geometric mean of two first-morning void urine UACR measurements with samples collected on two separate occasions within a 4-day period. The effect of BMS-813160 on urinary albumin excretion as measured by UACR values in participants with diabetic kidney disease after 12 weeks of treatment was assessed. certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period 60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
